This issue added to idea ECOM-5137

‚ÄúHi,

+The customer brought to our attention several additional issues:+

¬†

# Order notes are not passed in API to Pickpack. firstStop.notes field
# The apartment number of the destination address does not transfer. Please transfer to the address.apartmentNumber field: 
!file:///C:/Users/AnLe/AppData/Local/Temp/msohtmlclip1/01/clip_image001.png|thumbnail!
# !image-20231219-093731.png|width=252,height=232!
The customer claims that most orders have an additional phone number, please chain the phone number to the comments field (firstStop.notes). Suggest to add a separator such as: " *** "
# The customer claims that the if order (in [http://stor.ai|http://stor.ai|smart-link] ) is postponed to another day, then it does not transfer to another day and the appropriate project. Please make sure you are using projectHostId for such a use case.
# In the address object, please transfer both the street name and the street number if you have one

!image-20231219-093014.png|width=224,height=177!

¬†

Since we did not have access to [http://stor.ai|http://stor.ai|smart-link]  to perform comprehensive QA, please make sure that all data relevant to all customers is transferred to Pickpack properly.

Our API is broad and allows you to send a lot of data and it is very important to make sure that as much data as possible is transferred to the API.

¬†

Best regards,

Meir

Pickpack‚Äù

*Actual result:* The error details tooltip doesn't show in Hebrew

*Expected result:* The error details tooltip should show in Hebrew

After a conversation with Kobi, an urgent Jira is opened on the subject.

Physical accessibility arrangements appear on the website, but not on the mobile web and application.
We have a client who sued for this and must show the judge that the defects have been corrected.
After a conversation with Kobi, an urgent Jira is opened on the subject.

toString:
Scope of work:

*A-* *Configuration -Setting-Branch:*

# Pilot mode can only checked when Active for picking app is on
# Pilot mode save to DB with enable/disable value successfully
# Check Pilot mode when branch is default and online
# Check Pilot mode when branch is disable
# Place order with current branch when pilot is on
## Check order from front end site/ back office 
## Check order on collection app if exist?
## Check order on picking app?
# Place order with current branch when pilot is off
## Check order from front end site/ back office 
## Check order on collection app if exist?
## Check order on picking app?

*B-Configuration - Orders*

# When pilot mode is on, filter‚ÄùSend orders to be picked with external Picking System‚Äù is appeared
# When pilot mode is off, there is no filter‚ÄùSend orders to be picked with external Picking System‚Äù is appeared
# Check translation of text: ‚Äúend orders to be picked with external Picking System‚Äù‚Äù
# Check single order choice work well
# Check multiple order choice work well
# Check the order is not marked
# Check order is marked
## check explanation hover
## check indication at header of other page

*C- Picking app Back Office*

# Order is transferred to Picking back office 
## Check collection app will not have this order
## Check order at back office of Ecom site
## check the order details
# Check order status from back office is reflected to Ecom BO
# Check order detail such as amount of money, retailer name, branch  etc is correct.

*D-Picking App*

# Check the Order from Picking app

*D- Regression on Branch enable picking app:*

Make sure order on branch which is enable to pickup app work as normal

fromString:
Pilot mode feature  not working 
*We are supposed to go live with it in Tiv Taam on 17.12*
I need support ASAP!

1.pls you need to make sure that the feature works properly E2E - As written  [https://storai.atlassian.net/browse/PD-152|https://storai.atlassian.net/browse/PD-152|smart-link] 

2.The orders reach the 2 systems at the same time - Some of the product definition seems to be missing

!◊™◊û◊ï◊†◊î (2).png|width=1366,height=856!



3.Associating an order for collection in an external system is not saved

*the requested scenario:*

# I activated pilot mode -  ecom backend
# I entered an order in the front - r id 1214
# the order also arrived at ecom + picking backoffice - The order does not need to go to the picking
# In backend ecom- I marked the order for collection in an external system - I saved it - is not saved
Nothing happens - the order should disappear from the collection and appear only in Picking
# Later on there is the integration for bolet scales which are specialized departments so there too the order should appear/disappear respectively 



[~accountid:606ab30010a0a9006fced76a] [~accountid:5b437fd22726b92cd5366c45] [~accountid:60b47c42bbe237006ad2b6d7]
toString:
Pilot mode feature  not working 
*We are supposed to go live with it in Tiv Taam on 17.12*
I need support ASAP!

1.pls you need to make sure that the feature works properly E2E - As written  [https://storai.atlassian.net/browse/PD-152|https://storai.atlassian.net/browse/PD-152|smart-link] 

2.The orders reach the 2 systems at the same time - Some of the product definition seems to be missing and should be added to the development asap

Cc: [~accountid:61066723979810007081cc85], [~accountid:5ffebded642089014149d26d], 



There are some texts used in the BO that need translation into Hebrew:

# 'Monthly Spending- Textual Description'
# {spending amount} is {club points amount} {club points name} in a month
# '+Add spending amount'
# '+Add club points amount'
# '+Add club points name'



Although I have looked up the translation file in the PD [https://storai.atlassian.net/browse/PD-442|https://storai.atlassian.net/browse/PD-442|smart-link] and Figma [https://www.figma.com/file/IVniFyFjL5qbAVf3bE1joP/Club?type=design&node-id=2544-15966&mode=design&t=Xvny9lr7V3DY3K2J-4|https://www.figma.com/file/IVniFyFjL5qbAVf3bE1joP/Club?type=design&node-id=2544-15966&mode=design&t=Xvny9lr7V3DY3K2J-4|smart-link] and [https://www.figma.com/file/HgLLP0QaGQv1nCOOQWzN30/loyalty-facelift?type=design&node-id=2895-529&mode=design&t=0FmvSalGMCMAjwUJ-4|https://www.figma.com/file/HgLLP0QaGQv1nCOOQWzN30/loyalty-facelift?type=design&node-id=2895-529&mode=design&t=0FmvSalGMCMAjwUJ-4|smart-link], the translation file was not included there. Please provide us with the Hebrew translation.

fromString: [QA] SOW - Tiv Taam - NCR Error Reports on Uncharged Cashback Issues - Test Scenarios Design
toString: [QA] SOW - Tiv Taam - NCR Error Reports on Uncharged Cashback Issues - Analyze & Test Scenarios Design

*Test scenarios:*

{color:#ff5630}*Frontend (Prutah, Kikar, Mobile):*{color}

{color:#0747a6}*The error will only appear for customers who have this particular club and/or have such errors in the system (Cashback Charge Failed)*{color}

# Make an order with an insufficient reward points balance for Cashback redemption successfully on FE ‚Üí verify the error: *Insufficient Reward Points Balance* on the Orders page in the Backoffice
# Make an order with a system error is causing incorrect points balance to display on the website, even when there are not enough points for redemption successfully on FE ‚Üí verify the error: *Bug - Reward Points Balance Mismatch* on the Orders page in the Backoffice
# Make an order with Communication failure with the MultiPass server or communication issues at the branch level successfully on FE ‚Üí verify the error: *Communication Failure* on the Orders page in the Backoffice
# Make an order with Points expired due to removal after 180 days from the accumulation date, even if the order was placed before points expired successfully on FE ‚Üí verify the error: *Reward Points Expired* on the Orders page in the Backoffice
# Make an order: there is another error from NCR that we don‚Äôt recognize ‚Üí verify the error: *Other* on the Orders page in the Backoffice

{color:#ff5630}*Backoffice - CRM > Order List page:*{color}

# Check this feature is only supported for the retailer‚Äôs backoffice and *is not supported for Picking backoffice*
# Check the Alerts dropdown with the new option: ‚ÄúCashback Charged Issues‚Äù
# Check the display Cashback charged issues that will allow filtering and searching one of the five possible errors: 
- Insufficient Reward Points Balance
- Bug - Reward Points Balance Mismatch
- Communication Failure
- Reward Points Expired
- Other (don‚Äôt recognize)
# Check the Cashback charged issues dropdown when clicking on one of the five options ‚Üí It should show text on this field
# Check the Cashback charged issues dropdown when clicking on Remove Selection ‚Üí It should clear this field to empty
# {color:#ff991f}Check the Cashback charged issues when selecting more 2 options ‚Üí It is impossible, we only select one option to field -----> Need to confirmation{color}
# Verify the resulting filter when selecting the ‚ÄúCashback charged issues‚Äù and selecting one of four options ‚Üí The table result shows the order with the error same as the option chosen or NOT result
# Verify the resulting filter when selecting the ‚ÄúCashback charged issues‚Äù and *don‚Äôt choose* error options ‚Üí The table result shows the orders with both error or NOT result
# Verify the error details tooltip will appear when hovering over the error icon on the "Payment Method" column with the error details of the order cashback charge failed.
# Verify the errors are shown in both English and Hebrew

- Insufficient Reward Points Balance: ◊ú◊ê ◊û◊°◊§◊ô◊ß ◊ô◊™◊®◊™ ◊†◊ß◊ï◊ì◊ï◊™ ◊™◊í◊û◊ï◊ú
- Bug - Reward Points Balance Mismatch: ◊ë◊ê◊í - ◊ê◊ô ◊î◊™◊ê◊û◊î ◊©◊ú ◊ô◊™◊®◊™ ◊†◊ß◊ï◊ì◊ï◊™ ◊™◊í◊û◊ï◊ú
- Communication Failure: ◊õ◊©◊ú ◊ë◊™◊ß◊©◊ï◊®◊™
- Reward Points Expired: ◊§◊í ◊™◊ï◊ß◊£ ◊†◊ß◊ï◊ì◊ï◊™ ◊î◊™◊í◊û◊ï◊ú
- Other (don‚Äôt recognize)
# Check the Cashback charged issues dropdown when clicking on option(s) ‚Üí It should show text on this field
# Check the Cashback charged issues dropdown when clicking on ‚ÄúRemove Selection‚Äù : ◊û◊ó◊ß ◊ë◊ó◊ô◊®◊î ‚Üí It should clear this field to empty
# Check the Cashback charged issues when selecting more than 2 options ‚Üí It should have results related to the errors.
# Verify the resulting filter when selecting the ‚ÄúCashback charged issues‚Äù and selecting one of four options ‚Üí The table result shows the order with the error same as the option chosen or NOT result
# Verify the resulting filter when selecting ‚ÄúCashback charged issues‚Äù and *don‚Äôt choose* error options ‚Üí The table result shows the orders with both error or NOT result
# Verify the error details tooltip will appear when hovering over the error icon on the "Payment Method" column with the error details of the order cashback charge failed.
# Verify the resulting filter when selecting the other fields (Order status, other numbers, POS other id, etc‚Ä¶) and Cashback Charged Issues ‚Üí The table result shows the orders correctly with the data filter.
# Verify that the errors are shown in both English and Hebrew

The error will only appear for customers who have this particular club and/or have such errors in the system (Cashback Charge Failed) - Loyalty members are eligible to redeem cashback.

{color:#4c9aff}*Strategy testing:*{color} We cheat fake data to test local, and after release on production: we will go back to double-check this feature to see if it shows the corresponding error by real data

{color:#ff5630}*Frontend (Prutah, Kikar, Mobile):*{color}

# Make an order with an insufficient reward points balance for Cashback redemption ‚Üí verify the error: *Insufficient Reward Points Balance* on the Orders page in the Backoffice
# Make an order with a system error is causing incorrect points balance to display on the website, even when there are not enough points for redemption ‚Üí verify the error: *Bug - Reward Points Balance Mismatch* on the Orders page in the Backoffice
# Make an order with Communication failure with the MultiPass server or communication issues at the branch level ‚Üí verify the error: *Communication Failure* on the Orders page in the Backoffice
# Make an order with Points expired due to removal after 180 days from the accumulation date, even if the order was placed before points expired ‚Üí verify the error: *Reward Points Expired* on the Orders page in the Backoffice
# Make an order: there is another error from NCR that we don‚Äôt recognize ‚Üí verify the error: *Other* on the Orders page in the Backoffice

{color:#ff5630}*Backoffice - CRM > Order List page:*{color}

# Check this feature is only supported for the retailer‚Äôs backoffice and *is not supported for Picking backoffice*
# Check the Alerts dropdown with the new option: ‚ÄúCashback Charged Issues‚Äù -  ◊ë◊¢◊ô◊ï◊™ ◊ó◊ô◊ï◊ë ◊ß◊ê◊©◊ë◊ß
# Check the display for Cashback Charged issues that will allow filtering and searching for one of the five possible errors:
- Insufficient Reward Points Balance: ◊ú◊ê ◊û◊°◊§◊ô◊ß ◊ô◊™◊®◊™ ◊†◊ß◊ï◊ì◊ï◊™ ◊™◊í◊û◊ï◊ú
- Bug - Reward Points Balance Mismatch: ◊ë◊ê◊í - ◊ê◊ô ◊î◊™◊ê◊û◊î ◊©◊ú ◊ô◊™◊®◊™ ◊†◊ß◊ï◊ì◊ï◊™ ◊™◊í◊û◊ï◊ú
- Communication Failure: ◊õ◊©◊ú ◊ë◊™◊ß◊©◊ï◊®◊™
- Reward Points Expired: ◊§◊í ◊™◊ï◊ß◊£ ◊†◊ß◊ï◊ì◊ï◊™ ◊î◊™◊í◊û◊ï◊ú
- Other (don‚Äôt recognize)
# Check the Cashback charged issues dropdown when clicking on option(s) ‚Üí It should show text on this field
# Check the Cashback charged issues dropdown when clicking on ‚ÄúRemove Selection‚Äù : ◊û◊ó◊ß ◊ë◊ó◊ô◊®◊î ‚Üí It should clear this field to empty
# Check the Cashback charged issues when selecting more than 2 options ‚Üí It should have results related to the errors.
# Verify the resulting filter when selecting the ‚ÄúCashback charged issues‚Äù and selecting one of five options ‚Üí The table result shows the order with the error same as the option chosen or NOT result
# Verify the resulting filter when selecting ‚ÄúCashback charged issues‚Äù and *don‚Äôt choose* error options ‚Üí The table result shows the orders with both error or NOT result
# Verify the error details tooltip will appear when hovering over the error icon on the "Payment Method" column with the error details of the order cashback charge failed.
# Verify the resulting filter when selecting the other fields (Order status, other numbers, POS other id, etc‚Ä¶) and Cashback Charged Issues ‚Üí The table result shows the orders correctly with the data filter.
# Verify that the errors are shown in both English and Hebrew.

Store - [https://www.shopevergreenkosher.com/|https://www.shopevergreenkosher.com/|smart-link] 

The following customer is saying the address is coming up wrong in her order.

Her actual address is 241 W. 72nd Street NYC 10023 but the backend is getting 240 Riverside Boulevard. 

Is there anything that can be done to check to see why this is happening? This is becoming a common issue with this customer and they believe there is a bug in the system. 

!image-20231206-192002.png|width=752,height=254!

4. Allow permission: Notification on the phone

# Go to [https://eliy.sites.self-point.com/backend/#!/promotions/notification|https://eliy.sites.self-point.com/backend/#!/promotions/notification] with a valid account
# Enter User id: *2906489 (*[*qa-vn-ecom-01@stor.ai*|mailto:qa-vn-ecom-01@stor.ai]*)*

# Click on the Send notification button
# Verify the push notification on the phone

NCR ◊û◊ë◊ß◊©◊ô◊ù ◊©◊™◊¢◊ë◊ô◊®◊ï ERROE CODE ◊ê◊ï ◊î◊ï◊°◊§◊™ ◊©◊ì◊î DESCRIPTION ◊¢◊ú-◊û◊†◊™ ◊©◊ô◊ì◊¢◊ï ◊û◊î ◊ú◊©◊ú◊ï◊ó ◊ú◊õ◊ù ◊û◊î◊ß◊ï◊§◊î ◊ë◊û◊¶◊ë ◊õ◊ñ◊î
toString:
*The need:*

In cases where Cashback redemption was not processed despite the customer's request on the website, there could be various reasons for non-fulfillment:

# Insufficient reward points balance for Cashback redemption.
# System error is causing incorrect points balance to display on the website, even when there are not enough points for redemption.
# Communication failure with the MultiPass server or communication issues at the branch level.
# Points expired due to removal after 180 days from the accumulation date, even if the order was placed before points expired.

These warnings must inform NCR / customers about possible reasons for Cashback redemption issues and guide them in addressing these situations.



*Retailer Backoffice*:



* +Under the ‚ÄúOrder List‚Äù page > ‚ÄúStatus‚Äù coloumn, display the following possible errors in hover over the status:+

# Insufficient Reward Points Balance
# Bug - Reward Points Balance Mismatch
# Communication Failure
# Reward Points Expired



* Possible errors should be displayed only for charged orders in cases where cashback redemption was not processed despite the customer's request on the website.
* The retailer will be able to search orders that have these errors by filtering the ‚Äúcharge issues‚Äù.
* With the "charged issues" filter selected, there will be a new filter called "Cashback charged issues" that will allow filtering and searching one of the four possible errors.
* Existing error design should be applied.
* Support both Hebrew and English translations.



!image-20231113-115631.png|width=50%!



!image-20231113-115606.png|width=50%!













----

Receive the errors from NCR about cashback not being charged
and display the error on the order details screen in Backend

NCR ◊û◊ë◊ß◊©◊ô◊ù ◊©◊™◊¢◊ë◊ô◊®◊ï ERROE CODE ◊ê◊ï ◊î◊ï◊°◊§◊™ ◊©◊ì◊î DESCRIPTION ◊¢◊ú-◊û◊†◊™ ◊©◊ô◊ì◊¢◊ï ◊û◊î ◊ú◊©◊ú◊ï◊ó ◊ú◊õ◊ù ◊û◊î◊ß◊ï◊§◊î ◊ë◊û◊¶◊ë ◊õ◊ñ◊î
toString:
[https://www.figma.com/file/iwy2PYlspGrVUcwLe67S7Z/Back-office?type=design&node-id=3891-124&mode=design&t=g5nZlOlSFA3pm4iV-4|https://www.figma.com/file/iwy2PYlspGrVUcwLe67S7Z/Back-office?type=design&node-id=3891-124&mode=design&t=g5nZlOlSFA3pm4iV-4|smart-link] 

[translation Cashback charged issues.xlsx|https://storai-my.sharepoint.com/:x:/g/personal/shaked_b_stor_ai/Ed6GVuxttDlLv1JajwiIP74Bs2ZrT4jF1FfYXUMjLY36SQ?e=61gOkI]

*The need:*

If an order is charged but Cashback redemption fails for various reasons, we must get error details from NCR. These errors will be communicated to the customer on the Orders page in the Backoffice, allowing them to identify and address the issue.

+There are 4 possible errors from NCR:+

# Insufficient reward points balance for Cashback redemption.
# System error is causing incorrect points balance to display on the website, even when there are not enough points for redemption.
# Communication failure with the MultiPass server or communication issues at the branch level.
# Points expired due to removal after 180 days from the accumulation date, even if the order was placed before points expired.



*Retailer Backoffice*:

* +Under the ‚ÄúOrder List‚Äù page > ‚ÄúStatus‚Äù coloumn, display the following possible errors in hover over the status:+

# ‚ÄúInsufficient Reward Points Balance‚Äù
# ‚ÄúBug - Reward Points Balance Mismatch‚Äù
# ‚ÄúCommunication Failure‚Äù
# ‚ÄúReward Points Expired‚Äù



+Order List page:+

* The retailer will be able to filter orders that were charged but the Cashback redemption failed by filtering the ‚ÄúCharge issues‚Äù.
* If the "Charged issues" filter was selected, a new filter named "Cashback charged Issues" will be enabled. You can use it to filter the results based on the four possible errors.
* The current error design will be stayed the same, ensuring consistency.
* The errors shoould be shown both on Hebrew and English.



!image-20231113-115631.png|width=50%!



!image-20231113-115606.png|width=50%!

*The need:*

If an order is charged but Cashback redemption fails for various reasons, we must get error details from NCR. These errors will be communicated to the customer on the Orders page in the Backoffice, allowing them to identify and address the issue.

+There are 4 possible errors from NCR:+

# Insufficient reward points balance for Cashback redemption.
# System error is causing incorrect points balance to display on the website, even when there are not enough points for redemption.
# Communication failure with the MultiPass server or communication issues at the branch level.
# Points expired due to removal after 180 days from the accumulation date, even if the order was placed before points expired.



*Retailer Backoffice*: 

* +Under the ‚ÄúOrder List‚Äù page > ‚ÄúStatus‚Äù coloumn, display the following possible errors in hover over the status:+

# ‚ÄúCashback Charge failed - Insufficient Reward Points Balance‚Äù

# ‚ÄúCashback Charge failed - Communication Failure‚Äù
# ‚ÄúCashback Charge failed - Reward Points Expired‚Äù



+Order List page:+ 

* The retailer will be able to filter orders that were charged but the Cashback redemption failed by filtering the ‚ÄúCashback Charge issues‚Äù. You can use it to filter the results based on the four possible errors. 
* For orders with a "Charged" status, the errors will appear when hovering over the "Status" column.
* The current error design will be stayed the same, ensuring consistency. 
* The errors shoould be shown both on Hebrew and English.

ECOM Dragon Sprint 26, ECOM Dragon Sprint 27

Tested on [https://www.shop.netcostmarket.com/|https://www.shop.netcostmarket.com/|smart-link] 

When searching for a keyword in products (backend) the search does not come back with correct results. For example, a search for ‚Äúmarvel‚Äù comes back with ‚Äúmarcal‚Äù as the closest result while we have a product with ‚ÄúMarvel‚Äù in name. Images below:

!image-20230919-145747.png|width=1911,height=786!

!image-20230919-145753.png|width=1897,height=938!

fromString:
*Steps to reproduce:*

# Go to [https://testing.qa.prod.self-point.com/?domain=storewisetest.self-point.com|https://testing.qa.prod.self-point.com/?domain=storewisetest.self-point.com|smart-link]  with a valid account: [qa-vn-ecom-01@stor.ai|mailto:qa-vn-ecom-01@stor.ai]
# Add to the cart 4 items: ‚Ç™114.44
# Go to the checkout page
# Place the order successfully. (Order number: *10051478)*
# Go to the Order History page
# Verify the order number *10051478*

*Actual result:* The quantity was wrong so the total price was miscalculated on the Order history page: ‚Ç™33.96



*Expected result:* The quantity and total price should be the same as before: ‚Ç™114.44
toString:
*Steps to reproduce:*

# Go to [https://testing.qa.prod.self-point.com/?domain=storewisetest.self-point.com|https://testing.qa.prod.self-point.com/?domain=storewisetest.self-point.com|smart-link]  with a valid account: [qa-vn-ecom-01@stor.ai|mailto:qa-vn-ecom-01@stor.ai]
# Add to the cart 4 items: ‚Ç™114.44
!image-20231120-102846.png|width=1533,height=798!
# Go to the checkout page
# Place the order successfully. (Order number: *10051478)*
# Go to the Order History page
# Verify the order number *10051478*

*Actual result:* The quantity was wrong, so the total price was miscalculated on the Order history page: ‚Ç™33.96

!image-20231120-102858.png|width=1530,height=783!

*Expected result:* The quantity and total price should be the same as before: ‚Ç™114.44

[~accountid:63982282f3c3dfd71fe81beb] , [~accountid:642382017222b08f3e7382bf] , [~accountid:712020:0743b6b6-ea26-4081-90fa-6e1956e41bd1]  fyi

fromString: [Order history] [Total price] The total price was miscalculated on the Order history page
toString: [Unit & Weight] [Order history] The total price was miscalculated on the Order history page

[phase 2][Delivery Times Pages][Sync]Rest service stop working when sync by delivery type

From Retailer 11, create a group with picking store from Supersasi retailer.

!image-20231120-062404.png|width=1739,height=972!

From Supersasi, apply delivery slots to linked store with Delivery Type:‚ÄùDelivery‚Äù.  500 internal error return

url: 

{noformat}http://localhost:3000/backend/?domain=sasi.sites.self-point.com{noformat}

Screen shot:

!Screen Recording 2023-11-20 at 13.20.41.mov|width=1862,height=1048!
This issue is blocked by ECOM-2475

*Display of Linked Store Time Slots*

{color:#0747a6}*PD - 28:*{color} Once the picking store applies its time slots to the linked stores, a drop-down menu should appear for the linked store. The drop-down menu should provide two display options:

# *"Store Previous Time Slots"*: This choice showcases the time slots previously saved in the system when the picking store applied its time slots to the linked stores. 
#* Please hide the ‚ÄúDisable All-Day Slots‚Äù feature on this display (PD-10).

*Precondition:*

* Setting at ECOM: 
** Create a group of YBita: YBitan, Mega, Shul Mehadrin.
** Set up Delivery Provider BrigOz for YBitan
** Picking app for all retailer, all branches are enable for picking app.
* Set up at Picking app:
** Connect all retailer of group to picking app
** Add all linked store into admin store

*Scenario:*

*A. Picking store*

#  make order‚Üí picking app - > edit order.
## Check  picking store Ecom back office :
### check on order on picking store back office.
### check brand name
### check store indicator
### check order status.
### check order information such as total money, address, items, assignee.
## Check Picking app:
### Check time slot
### Delivery area
### Order number
### Status
### Open oder and collect normally.
## Checking picking back office:
### Check time slot
### Delivery area
### Order number
### Status
### Open order details and order action: assign picker, change status, change picking brand, show status log

*Test Scenario:*

{color:#006644}Create group{color} ‚Üí {color:#ff991f}Create areas {color}‚Üí {color:#bf2600}Create time slot from picking store{color} ‚Üí Make order‚Üí{color:#ff991f} Check back office Ecom {color}‚Üípicking app/back office ->{color:#ff991f} Check/Action back office Ecom. {color}

Create Order ‚Üí Update order.

Create Order ‚Üí Cancel order.

* {color:#006644}*Create group*{color}*:*
** Group YBitan at Retailer 11 :
*** Create, add, remove, edit retailer into group.
*** Add, remove, edit picking store of group.
*** Add/remove retailer of a existing group ( group has been works for a while).
*** Change picking app  ( group has been works for a while).
*** Check indicators of all stores inside group.
* {color:#ff991f}*Create areas*{color}: Create, update, active, inactive areas from picking store.
*  {color:#bf2600}*Create time slot from picking store:*{color}
** Create / edit/ delete time slot: From picking app, apply times slot to linked store.
* {color:#6554c0}*Making order*{color}{color:#ffbdad} {color} : from store: picking store, all linked store, update order, cancel order.
* {color:#bf2600}*Check back office ECOM*{color}{color:#bf2600}:{color}
** check on order on picking store back office/ linked store back office.
** check brand name
** check store indicator
** check order status.
** check order information such as total money, address, item, assigneed,.
* {color:#008da6}*Picking app/back office:*{color}
** Add , remove linked store into admin store
** Check linked store status: Active, inactive, waiting for activation
** Check orders from picking store and linked stores from ecom: check order pages, order detail in admin store of picking app: order id, brand logo, status, info such money count, items‚Ä¶
** Change status of order ‚Üí check Ecom back office status.
** Check Order in picking app:  order id, brand logo, status, info such money count, items‚Ä¶
* {color:#ff991f}*Check/Action back office Ecom:*{color}
** Resend to picking app incase connect to picking app failed
** Change status of order: New, Done, Missing, OnHold.
** Refund: by entire order, by amount, by products( refund many times), exceeds the allow amount‚Ä¶
** Payment Options
** Edit Delivery time
** Show status log
** Add items
** Duplicate order
** Carbon copy Order
** Update main delivery provider
** Update number of boxes
* Regular retailer:
** Place order ‚Üí edit, cancel ‚Üí check ping app ‚Üí check back office.

** Check orders from picking store and linked stores from ecom: check order pages, order detail in admin store of picking app: order id, brand logo, status, info such money count, items‚Ä¶
** Change status of order ‚Üí check Ecom back office status.
** Check Order in picking app:  order id, brand logo, status, info such money count, items
* {color:#ff991f}*Check/Action back office Ecom:*{color}
** Resend to picking app incase connect to picking app failed
** Change status of order: New, Done, Missing, OnHold.
** Refund: by entire order, by amount, by products( refund many times), exceeds the allow amount‚Ä¶
** Payment Options
** Edit Delivery time
** Show status log
** Add items
** Duplicate order
** Carbon copy Order
** Update main delivery provider
** Update number of boxes
* Regular retailer:

Create group ‚Üí Create areas ‚Üí Create time slot ‚Üí Make order‚Üí Check back office Ecom ‚ÜíPicking app/back office picking app -> Check/Action back office Ecom. 

Create Order ‚Üí Update order.

Create Order ‚Üí Cancel order.

fromString: [QA] ECOM - Support for Multi-Brand - Time Slots | Phase 2 - Picking Store -Reservation - Test Execution
toString: [QA] ECOM - Phase 2 - Picking Store -Reservation - Test Execution

* *PD ‚Äì 25:* ¬†‚Äú+Linked Store Delivery Slot Reservation‚Äù Settings+
** Check languages.
** Check displayed text.
** Check area drop down list incase zero area, long list of area.
** Change the number % : 0; 10; Max integer
** Check add button, add many sections as possible
** Disable/Enable this linked store delivery slot reservation.
** Delete this record
** Change the number inside :‚ÄúRelease: unused reservation to..‚Äù : 0, 10, max.
** Note: Total of allocating is less than 100.

fromString:
* *PD ‚Äì 25:* ¬†‚Äú+Linked Store Delivery Slot Reservation‚Äù Settings+
** Check languages.
** Check displayed text.
** Check area drop down list incase zero area, long list of area.
** Change the number % : 0; 10; Max integer
** Check add button, add many sections as possible
** Disable/Enable this linked store delivery slot reservation.
** Delete this record
** Change the number inside :‚ÄúRelease: unused reservation to..‚Äù : 0, 10, max.
** Note: Total of allocating is less than 100.
toString:
* {color:#0747a6}*PD - 22:* {color}+‚ÄùLinked Stores Delivery Slot Reservation‚Äù+
** The settings of PD- 21 and PD- 22 (‚ÄúTagged user‚Äôs reservation‚Äù and ‚ÄúLinked Stores Delivery Slot Reservation‚Äù) will only appear if a quantity for the delivery has been defined.
** By default, the system uses a first-come-first-sereved order handling for linked stores. This feature allows the picking store to reserve % of incoming orders on the delivery slots for linked stores. For the remaining linked stores, the system continues to use the first-come-first-served approach for order handling.
** {color:#0747a6}*PD - 22.1:*{color} If the picking store hasn‚Äôt clicked the "Apply delivery slot settings to linked stores" button, a red message will appear: "Settings will be applied after clicking the 'Apply Delivery Slot Settings to Linked Stores' button."
** {color:#0747a6}*PD - 22.2:*{color}{color:#ff991f} {color}+‚ÄúUse+ {color:#36b37e}+System settings default+{color} +for stores reservation‚Äù checkbox.+
*** The ‚Äú+Linked Stores Delivery Slot Reservation+‚Äù setting will also be in the "Delivery Settings" in Configuration. The settings in the Configuration are the default settings for all delivery slots.
*** The checkbox default is marked. When this checkbox is checked, +all the settings below are disabled+ and reflect the default settings on Configurations. Any changes in the Configuration "Delivery Settings" will automatically update this delivery slot. 
*** When the retailer deselects this checkbox, all the settings below become editable. Then, the picking stores can change the default system settings for this specific delivery slot. Any changes made in the delivery settings in Configuration will not affect this delivery slot.
*** By clicking the ‚Äúsystem settings default,‚Äù (only) the picking store will be directed to the ‚ÄúConfigurations‚Äù > ‚ÄúDelivery‚Äù tab.
** {color:#0747a6}*PD - 22.3:*{color}{color:#ff991f} {color}+"Reserve % of incoming orders on the delivery slots for linked stores"+ toggle
*** Add an explanation: ‚Äú*For the remaining linked stores, the system continues to use the first-come-first-served approach for order handling.‚Äù
*** On Configurations, this toggle will be set to OFF by default.
*** When the toggle is OFF, the system will use a first-come-first-served order handling for all linked stores.
** {color:#0747a6}*PD - 22.4:*{color} +If the toggle is ON:  ‚ÄúReserve [number field]% of the Delivery slot quota for [store name].‚Äù+
*** Retailers can reserve a specific delivery quota for a specific store.
*** With the toggle ON and delivery quota reserved, the system will dynamically save the specified percentage of the delivery quota for the defined store. The system will continue to utilize the first-come-first-served order handling approach for the remaining stores.
*** ‚ÄúAdd‚Äù (+) button: Retailers can reserve a specific delivery quota for another store.
*** ‚ÄúDelete‚Äù button will appear only for the first store reserved. at least one store reservation is mandatory when the toggle is ON.
*** If the percentages of the allocated stores sum up to 100%, do not display the 'add' button.
** {color:#0747a6}*PD - 22.5:*{color} +"Release" unused reservations to all stores [X] hours before the delivery slot begins.+
** {color:#0747a6}*PD - 23:*{color}{color:#0747a6} {color}+Time span of expiration-+ {color:#ff991f}Same functionality.{color}
* *PD ‚Äì 25:* ¬†‚Äú+Linked Store Delivery Slot Reservation‚Äù Settings+
** Check languages.
** Check displayed text.
** Check area drop down list incase zero area, long list of area.
** Change the number % : 0; 10; Max integer
** Check add button, add many sections as possible
** Disable/Enable this linked store delivery slot reservation.
** Delete this record
** Change the number inside :‚ÄúRelease: unused reservation to..‚Äù : 0, 10, max.
** Note: Total of allocating is less than 100.

fromString:
* {color:#0747a6}*PD - 22:* {color}+‚ÄùLinked Stores Delivery Slot Reservation‚Äù+
** The settings of PD- 21 and PD- 22 (‚ÄúTagged user‚Äôs reservation‚Äù and ‚ÄúLinked Stores Delivery Slot Reservation‚Äù) will only appear if a quantity for the delivery has been defined.
** By default, the system uses a first-come-first-sereved order handling for linked stores. This feature allows the picking store to reserve % of incoming orders on the delivery slots for linked stores. For the remaining linked stores, the system continues to use the first-come-first-served approach for order handling.
** {color:#0747a6}*PD - 22.1:*{color} If the picking store hasn‚Äôt clicked the "Apply delivery slot settings to linked stores" button, a red message will appear: "Settings will be applied after clicking the 'Apply Delivery Slot Settings to Linked Stores' button."
** {color:#0747a6}*PD - 22.2:*{color}{color:#ff991f} {color}+‚ÄúUse+ {color:#36b37e}+System settings default+{color} +for stores reservation‚Äù checkbox.+
*** The ‚Äú+Linked Stores Delivery Slot Reservation+‚Äù setting will also be in the "Delivery Settings" in Configuration. The settings in the Configuration are the default settings for all delivery slots.
*** The checkbox default is marked. When this checkbox is checked, +all the settings below are disabled+ and reflect the default settings on Configurations. Any changes in the Configuration "Delivery Settings" will automatically update this delivery slot. 
*** When the retailer deselects this checkbox, all the settings below become editable. Then, the picking stores can change the default system settings for this specific delivery slot. Any changes made in the delivery settings in Configuration will not affect this delivery slot.
*** By clicking the ‚Äúsystem settings default,‚Äù (only) the picking store will be directed to the ‚ÄúConfigurations‚Äù > ‚ÄúDelivery‚Äù tab.
** {color:#0747a6}*PD - 22.3:*{color}{color:#ff991f} {color}+"Reserve % of incoming orders on the delivery slots for linked stores"+ toggle
*** Add an explanation: ‚Äú*For the remaining linked stores, the system continues to use the first-come-first-served approach for order handling.‚Äù
*** On Configurations, this toggle will be set to OFF by default.
*** When the toggle is OFF, the system will use a first-come-first-served order handling for all linked stores.
** {color:#0747a6}*PD - 22.4:*{color} +If the toggle is ON:  ‚ÄúReserve [number field]% of the Delivery slot quota for [store name].‚Äù+
*** Retailers can reserve a specific delivery quota for a specific store.
*** With the toggle ON and delivery quota reserved, the system will dynamically save the specified percentage of the delivery quota for the defined store. The system will continue to utilize the first-come-first-served order handling approach for the remaining stores.
*** ‚ÄúAdd‚Äù (+) button: Retailers can reserve a specific delivery quota for another store.
*** ‚ÄúDelete‚Äù button will appear only for the first store reserved. at least one store reservation is mandatory when the toggle is ON.
*** If the percentages of the allocated stores sum up to 100%, do not display the 'add' button.
** {color:#0747a6}*PD - 22.5:*{color} +"Release" unused reservations to all stores [X] hours before the delivery slot begins.+
** {color:#0747a6}*PD - 23:*{color}{color:#0747a6} {color}+Time span of expiration-+ {color:#ff991f}Same functionality.{color}
* *PD ‚Äì 25:* ¬†‚Äú+Linked Store Delivery Slot Reservation‚Äù Settings+
** Check languages.
** Check displayed text.
** Check area drop down list incase zero area, long list of area.
** Change the number % : 0; 10; Max integer
** Check add button, add many sections as possible
** Disable/Enable this linked store delivery slot reservation.
** Delete this record
** Change the number inside :‚ÄúRelease: unused reservation to..‚Äù : 0, 10, max.
** Note: Total of allocating is less than 100.

fromString:
Bug in the app and mobile web when filtering products by tag.
When you filter vegan it brings meat, when you filter gluten free it brings bread.
[~accountid:5b437fd22726b92cd5366c45] 


!image-20231114-093418.png|width=359,height=536!
toString:
Bug in the app and mobile web when filtering products by tag.
When you go to the specials tab in the app & the mobile web and click on the "vegan" filter, there appear products that shouldn't appear, products that don't have the "vegan" tag at all.
[~accountid:5b437fd22726b92cd5366c45] 

!image-20231114-093418.png|width=359,height=536!

Hi,




Renee ordered this morning and the gateway error was there again.

She was charged twice on cardknox and I voided one of the charges.

Please see below.




Thanks

Sara



From: Renee Thometz <thometzr@s-vt.com>
Sent: Wednesday, November 8, 2023 5:22 AM

Price fluctuated on check out again. Pic below.

Never received an order confirmation # on store ai site after I checked out so I clicked the button again (and it let me) because I didn't think it went through with gateway error.

Can you please look into this and cancel one of the orders.

toString:
Customer ID 2602758

*Issue 1*

Gateway time out three times on checkout. Pic below.

!attachment.jpg|width=640,height=480!

*Issue 2*

The price fluctuated on checkout this time instead of the basket. Pic‚Äôs below one taken after the next. and as seen in the video on ticket [https://storai.atlassian.net/browse/SP-24642|https://storai.atlassian.net/browse/SP-24642|smart-link] 

!image-20231108-144238.png|width=351,height=449!

!image-20231108-144303.png|width=595,height=439!

*Issue 3* 

Initially did not receive an order confirmation # on store ai site after I checked out so I clicked the button again (and it let me) because I didn't think it went through with a gateway error.

Notice the time differences, it does not look like an update order.

Did receive two emails with the same order #9978218.

!image-20231108-144415.png|width=304,height=161!

If the order was updated it would say it on the email title like this. 

!image-20231108-145153.png|width=298,height=176!

The credit card was charged twice for this order totaling  $118.18 each.


Backend showing more info about this order

!image-20231108-143717.png|width=891,height=344!

# Check the Pop-up title field with the limitation characters: 23/50 (less or more)
# Check Pop-up title field with ‚ÄúReset to default text‚Äù (◊©◊ó◊ñ◊ï◊® ◊ë◊®◊ô◊®◊™ ◊î◊û◊ó◊ì◊ú ◊©◊ú ◊î◊†◊ï◊°◊ó): when clicking on it, this field automatically removes current data and resets to default text.

# Check Pop-up text (◊†◊ï◊°◊ó ◊î◊î◊ï◊ì◊¢◊î ◊î◊ß◊ï◊§◊¶◊™) field with the limitation characters: 150/150 (less or more)

# Check the Button text (◊†◊ï◊°◊ó ◊î◊õ◊§◊™◊ï◊®) field with the default text: _Update Now_
# Check Button text field with the limitation characters: 15/15 (less or more)

# Verify the data when updated successfully on the backoffice

*Frontend:*

# Show pop-up forcing users to update to the latest version: The button‚Äôs color is the same brand of retailer color
# Check the redirection when clicking on Update Now button: iOS - redirect users to the App Store. Android - redirect users to Google Play
# Check the use of the app when the user has not updated to the last version ‚Üí The app cannot be used
# Check the time to display pop-up: always show until the user clicks on the Update Now button to Update the lastest version
# Verify behavior when the updated new version is successful ‚Üí The user be able to use the app normally

fromString:
On the website, the customer can mark a check box at the end of the purchase that he approves leaving a delivery outside the door. After testing MCK (which turned off the feature because it is problematic), the check box does not appear on the mobile web and the application.

Screenshots from Super Mekcado (retailer):
toString:
On the website, the customer can mark a check box at the end of the purchase that he approves leaving a delivery outside the door. After testing MCK (which turned off the feature because it is problematic), the check box does not appear on the mobile web and the application.

Screenshots from Super Mekcado (retailer 1433):

website:

!image-20231109-114145.png|width=1902,height=906!

Mobile web:

!image-20231109-114152.png|width=288,height=590!
This issue is parent of PD-443

*Prerequisite*: Place order successful, replacing/missing one of products in collecting.

*Reproduce*:

Step 1: Make an order with Regular, Taxable and Weighable products

Step 2: Pay partly with EBT SNAP and Credit card

Step 3: Missed/Replaced one of products in process of collecting and finish the collecting

*Actual*:

*Email notification missed/replaced*

!image-20231109-102453.png|width=1302,height=290!

*Back-office*

!image-20231109-102804.png|width=1486,height=646!



Total price is shown: $0.00

*Expected:* 

Total price, it should be displayed correct amount with the line instead of $0.00 and below it is 0

*Precondition:* 
Product ID: 3356393

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Setting OutOfStockDate = 2023-09-20 04:22:03.897
# Turning on the Out-of-Stock Duration in BO
# Setting Maximum Out-of-stock days (Default: 30) of Fresh Fruit (Tree ID = {{79705}})
# Run indexer for tree-categories and products

*Actual result:* The product has been out of stock for more than the defined number of days, it isn't removed from the website



*Expected result:* If a product is out of stock for more than the defined number of days, it will be removed from the website.

|6|◊©◊ô◊†◊ï◊ô ◊¢◊ô◊¶◊ï◊ë◊ô ◊©◊ú ◊®◊õ◊ô◊ë ◊û◊ó◊©◊ë◊ï◊ü ◊†◊ß◊ï◊ì◊ï◊™ ‚Äì ◊î◊ï◊®◊ì◊™ ◊°◊ï◊í◊®◊ô◊ô◊ù ◊ï◊î◊ï◊°◊§◊™ ◊ò◊ß◊°◊ò, ◊î◊ó◊ú◊§◊™ ◊ê◊ô◊ô◊ß◊ï◊ü ◊¢◊ô◊í◊ï◊ú ◊ë◊û◊¢◊ï◊ô◊ü.|



*Product Definitions:*

+Two adjustments need to be made to the loyalty page:+

# For loyalty members, add a barcode to the ‚ÄúExternal Services‚Äù pop-up component.[https://www.figma.com/file/IVniFyFjL5qbAVf3bE1joP/Club?type=design&node-id=2544-15966&mode=design&t=Xvny9lr7V3DY3K2J-4|https://www.figma.com/file/IVniFyFjL5qbAVf3bE1joP/Club?type=design&node-id=2544-15966&mode=design&t=Xvny9lr7V3DY3K2J-4|smart-link] 
# For non-loyalty members, adjust the design of the ‚ÄúPoints Calculator‚Äù component  [https://www.figma.com/file/HgLLP0QaGQv1nCOOQWzN30/loyalty-facelift?type=design&node-id=2895-529&mode=design&t=0FmvSalGMCMAjwUJ-4|https://www.figma.com/file/HgLLP0QaGQv1nCOOQWzN30/loyalty-facelift?type=design&node-id=2895-529&mode=design&t=0FmvSalGMCMAjwUJ-4|smart-link] 
#* On the progress bar, change the circle shape to an oriented shape.
!image-20231120-094801.png|width=2488,height=1210!
#* Add an option to edit the first sentence, the monthly spending text, under the progress bar - Frontend & Backoffice.
#* Instead of showing only numeric values, we will show both numeric values and textual explanations. 
#* For example:
#** +Backoffice+: {spending amount} is {club points amount} {club points name} in a month.
#** +Frontend+: ‚Äú1500 NIS is 150 Tiv Points in a month‚Äù.

!image-20231120-094730.png|width=2050,height=2894!

toString: [QA] ECOM - Support for Multi-Brand - Time Slots | Phase 2 - Back-office configuration - Test Execution

*Backoffice Configurations*

# {color:#0747a6}*PD - 24:*{color} ‚Äú+Checkout Time Slot Display Management‚Äù+
#* {color:#bf2600}Former name: ‚ÄúCustomer display‚Äù{color}
#* Add an explanation: ‚ÄúThis setting allows the retailer to control how the available time slots for order delivery or pickup are displayed to customers during the checkout process‚Äù
#* 2 Options:
#*# "Upcoming Week" 
#*#* {color:#bf2600}Former name: ‚ÄúFollowing week‚Äù{color}
#*#* Add an explanation: ‚ÄúShow available time slots for the upcoming week.‚Äù
#*# "Select Days: [Input the number of days] days (until August 25, 2023)‚Äù
#*#* {color:#bf2600}Former name: ‚ÄúBy days.‚Äù{color}
#*#* Add an explanation: ‚ÄúShow a specific range of days within which the customer can schedule their order delivery or pickup.‚Äù
#* One choice selection
#* ‚ÄúUpdate‚Äù Button
# {color:#0747a6}*PD - 25:*{color} ‚Äú+Linked Store Delivery Slot Reservation‚Äù Settings+
#* This setting is also in the "Delivery Times" pop-up (Please read the {color:#0747a6}*PD - 22).*{color} The settings in the Configuration are the default settings for all delivery slots.
#* Suppose the picking store hasn‚Äôt clicked the "Apply delivery slot settings to linked stores" button. In that case, a red message will appear: "Settings will be applied after clicking the 'Apply Delivery Slot Settings to Linked Stores' button on the Delivery Time‚Äù page.‚Äù

toString:
*Backoffice Configurations*

# {color:#0747a6}*PD - 24:*{color} ‚Äú+Checkout Time Slot Display Management‚Äù+
#* {color:#bf2600}Former name: ‚ÄúCustomer display‚Äù{color}
#* Add an explanation: ‚ÄúThis setting allows the retailer to control how the available time slots for order delivery or pickup are displayed to customers during the checkout process‚Äù
#* 2 Options:
#*# "Upcoming Week" 
#*#* {color:#bf2600}Former name: ‚ÄúFollowing week‚Äù{color}
#*#* Add an explanation: ‚ÄúShow available time slots for the upcoming week.‚Äù
#*# "Select Days: [Input the number of days] days (until August 25, 2023)‚Äù
#*#* {color:#bf2600}Former name: ‚ÄúBy days.‚Äù{color}
#*#* Add an explanation: ‚ÄúShow a specific range of days within which the customer can schedule their order delivery or pickup.‚Äù
#* One choice selection
#* ‚ÄúUpdate‚Äù Button
# {color:#0747a6}*PD - 25:*{color} ‚Äú+Linked Store Delivery Slot Reservation‚Äù Settings+
#* This setting is also in the "Delivery Times" pop-up (Please read the {color:#0747a6}*PD - 22).*{color} The settings in the Configuration are the default settings for all delivery slots.
#* Suppose the picking store hasn‚Äôt clicked the "Apply delivery slot settings to linked stores" button. In that case, a red message will appear: "Settings will be applied after clicking the 'Apply Delivery Slot Settings to Linked Stores' button on the Delivery Time‚Äù page.‚Äù

*Test scenario:*

* *PD - 24:* ‚ÄúCheckout Time Slot Display Management‚Äù:
** Check languages.
** Check displayed text.
** ¬†Select display following week -> check save setting on database and front end.
** Unselect display on following week option -> check save setting on database and front end.
** Change number of displays by days without select ratio button.
** Change number of displays by days ¬†and select display by days
** Input number 0,1, 10000000 and select then save.
* *PD ‚Äì 25:* ¬†‚Äú+Linked Store Delivery Slot Reservation‚Äù Settings+
** Check languages.
** Check displayed text.
** Check area drop down list incase zero area, long list of area.
** Change the number % : 0; 10; Max integer
** Check add button, add many sections as possible
** Disable/Enable this linked store delivery slot reservation.
** Delete this record
** Change the number inside :‚ÄúRelease: unused reservation to..‚Äù : 0, 10, max.
** Note: Total of allocating is less than 100.

#* Suppose the picking store hasn‚Äôt clicked the "Apply delivery slot settings to linked stores" button. In that case, a red message will appear: "Settings will be applied after clicking the 'Apply Delivery Slot Settings to Linked Stores' button on the Delivery Time‚Äù page.‚Äù

*Test scenario:*

* *PD - 24:* ‚ÄúCheckout Time Slot Display Management‚Äù:
** Check languages.
** Check displayed text.
** ¬†Select display following week -> check save setting on database and front end.
** Unselect display on following week option -> check save setting on database and front end.
** Change number of displays by days without select ratio button.
** Change number of displays by days ¬†and select display by days
** Input number 0,1, 10000000 and select then save.
* *PD ‚Äì 25:* ¬†‚Äú+Linked Store Delivery Slot Reservation‚Äù Settings+
** Check languages.
** Check displayed text.
** Check area drop down list incase zero area, long list of area.
** Change the number % : 0; 10; Max integer
** Check add button, add many sections as possible
** Disable/Enable this linked store delivery slot reservation.
** Delete this record
** Change the number inside :‚ÄúRelease: unused reservation to..‚Äù : 0, 10, max.
** Note: Total of allocating is less than 100.

fromString: [QA] ECOM - Support for Multi-Brand - Time Slots | Phase 2 - Picking Store - Statistics
toString: [QA] ECOM - Support for Multi-Brand - Time Slots | Phase 2 - Picking Store - Statistics - Test Execution

* Statistics button: {color:#0747a6}PD-8{color}
** Check info display on graph is correct.
** Check that regular store will only have ‚ÄúAreas‚Äù statistics displayed.
* Deliver slots window and hover should include:{color:#0747a6}PD-9{color}
** Check hour range with format: AM: AM, AM: PM, PM: PM. Sensitive time duration such as: 0 AM: 12 PM, 0 AM: 23PM.
** Check correct message for picking store:‚Äù+For a picking store:+ [Received orders from the Picking Store and linked stores] out of [total order capacity]. For example, 8/10.‚Äù incase:
*** valid case: 0/max, 1/max-1.
*** valid case: -1/max, --100/max+1
** Check correct message for linked store:‚Äù+For a linked store:+ [Received orders from the linked store] out of [the picking store's allocation]‚Äù

fromString: [QA] ECOM - Support for Multi-Brand - Time Slots | Phase 2 - Picking Store - Statistics - Test Execution

** Check correct message for picking store:‚Äù+For a picking store:+ [Received orders from the Picking Store and linked stores] out of [total order capacity]. For example, 8/10.‚Äù incase:

** Check correct message for linked store:‚Äù+For a linked store:+ [Received orders from the linked store] out of [the picking store's allocation]‚Äù
[QA] ECOM - Support for Multi-Brand - Time Slots | Phase 2 - Statistics - Test Execution

toString:
* {color:#0747a6}*PD-8.1:* {color}By clicking on this button, a pop-up will show up. According to the selected day/week view, the pop-up will have "Areas" and "Stores" stats. {color:#ff991f}The graphs will show how many deliveries each store/area has compared to their total allocated deliveries by the picking store.{color}
* {color:#0747a6}*PD-8.2:*{color} Hovering on each graph bar will display the relevant store name + the number of received orders.
* {color:#0747a6}*PD-8.3:* {color}Regular stores will only have the ‚ÄúAreas‚Äù statistics displayed.



* Test Scenario:
** Check Statistics button on linked store, picking store, regular store.
* 
** Check info display on graph is correct.
** Check that regular store will only have ‚ÄúAreas‚Äù statistics displayed.

* {color:#0747a6}*PD-8.2:*{color} Hovering on each graph bar will display the relevant store name + the number of received orders.
* {color:#0747a6}*PD-8.3:* {color}Regular stores will only have the ‚ÄúAreas‚Äù statistics displayed.



* Test Scenario:
** Check Statistics button on linked store: no, picking store: yes, regular store: *Passed*
** Check display weekly/ daily: Passed
** Check Regular stores 
*** will only have the ‚ÄúAreas‚Äù statistics displayed: *Passed*
*** place order from many areas, check the number and column is correct.
*** Check in case there is no orders.
** Check detail of regular stores statistic:
** Check info display on graph is correct.
** Check that regular store will only have ‚ÄúAreas‚Äù statistics displayed.

# PD-1: Picking Store Pop-up and PD-2: Unified Delivery Slot Settings
#* Incase ‚ÄúIs Active‚Äù = ON inside group management
#** check picking store:
#*** Check pop up message appear for the first time access "Delivery Times" page({color:#0747a6}*PD-1)* {color}
#*** Check translation of this message
#*** Check press ‚ÄúConfirm‚Äù button , unified delivery slot settings appears
#*** Check case Do not press ‚Äúconfirm button‚Äù ‚Üí What happens?
#*** Check incase access "Delivery Times" page second time: no pop up message
#*** Check ‚Äúbutton:Apply Delivery Slots to Linked Stores ‚Äù is visible ({color:#0747a6}PD- 2.1{color})
#*** Press ‚ÄúApply Delivery slots to linked stores‚Äù button
#**** Confirm Action dialog appear ({color:#0747a6}PD- 2.2{color})
#**** Check language of confirm action dialog
#**** Check Calendar  appear: display today info by default, select some day
#**** Add Time Start;.. to:‚Ä¶.

#*** Check incase access "Delivery Times" page second time: no pop up message
#*** Check ‚Äúbutton:Apply Delivery Slots to Linked Stores ‚Äù is visible ({color:#0747a6}PD- 2.1{color})

toString:
# PD-1: Picking Store Pop-up and PD-2: Unified Delivery Slot Settings
#* Incase ‚ÄúIs Active‚Äù = ON inside group management
#** check picking store:
#*** Check pop up message appear for the first time access "Delivery Times" page({color:#0747a6}*PD-1)*{color}
#*** Check translation of this message
#*** Check press ‚ÄúConfirm‚Äù button , unified delivery slot settings appears
#*** Check case Do not press ‚Äúconfirm button‚Äù ‚Üí What happens?
#*** Check incase access "Delivery Times" page second time: no pop up message
#*** Check ‚Äúbutton:Apply Delivery Slots to Linked Stores ‚Äù is visible ({color:#0747a6}PD- 2.1{color})
#*** Press ‚ÄúApply Delivery slots to linked stores‚Äù button
#**** Confirm Action dialog appear ({color:#0747a6}PD- 2.2{color})
#**** Check language of confirm action dialog
#**** Check Calendar  appear: display today info by default, select some day
#**** Add Time Start;.. to:‚Ä¶.
#**** Press Cancel ‚Üí check nothing is applied
#**** Open the Confirm Action dialog again ‚Üí press Apply ({color:#0747a6}PD- 2.3{color})
#***** By clicking on the ‚ÄúApply,‚Äù the "Apply delivery slot settings to linked stores" button will be removed.
#***** Check the selected apply will be sync to linked store: check at back office of linked store and place order from linked store
#***** Check Linked stores will not be able to add/edit delivery slots, only watch their details on the calendar case: Linked store has the same retailer with picking store, Linked store is not the same retailer with picking store
#***** Check language translation of this screen.
#** Check linked store incase ‚ÄúIs Active‚Äù = ON
#*** Access "Delivery Times" page from linked store
#*** Check linked store do not have ‚ÄúApply Delivery Slots‚Äù
#** Check regular store: which do not have this setting too.
#* FLOW: Turn on ‚Üí turn off ‚Üí turn on again. Check behavior of system.
# New ‚ÄúDelivery Times‚Äù page Display
#* Indication ({color:#0747a6}PD- 3{color})
#** Linked store: there is ("Picking Store: [Store Name]") indication and delivery times display
#** Picking store: picking store indication and delivery times display
#** Regular store: no indication, check delivery times display?
#** FLOW: change store from regular ‚Üí linked store ‚Üí remove group ‚Üí become picking store ‚Üí become regular again.
#* Day/Week/Today's Schedule ({color:#0747a6}PD- 4{color})
#** Check Day View
#** Check Week view
#** Check .. dots.
#* Check +‚ÄúDelivery Type‚Äù drop-down (+{color:#0747a6}+PD-5+{color}+)+
#** Switch forth and back delivery type.
#* Check +List of Delivery Area Checkboxes (filter)  (+{color:#4c9aff}+PD-6+{color}+)+
#** Check by default, all check boxes are checked
#** Select some check boxes, he corresponding delivery slots for that area will be hidden.
#** Change the colors black/pink
#* Go to delivery setting button: {color:#0747a6}PD-7{color}
#** Picking store: display this button.
#** Click on this button
#** Check linked Store/ Regular store: do not display this button.
#** Check lick on apply, it will re-direct to Configurations > Settings > ‚ÄúDelivery Settings‚Äù tab.
#* Statistics button: {color:#0747a6}PD-8{color}
#** Check info display on graph is correct.
#** Check that regular store will only have ‚ÄúAreas‚Äù statistics displayed.
#* Deliver slots window and hover should include:{color:#0747a6}PD-9{color}
#** Check hour range with format: AM: AM, AM: PM, PM: PM. Sensitive time duration such as: 0 AM: 12 PM, 0 AM: 23PM.
#** Check correct message for picking store:‚Äù+For a picking store:+ [Received orders from the Picking Store and linked stores] out of [total order capacity]. For example, 8/10.‚Äù incase:
#*** valid case: 0/max, 1/max-1.
#*** valid case: -1/max, --100/max+1
#** Check correct message for linked store:‚Äù+For a linked store:+ [Received orders from the linked store] out of [the picking store's allocation]‚Äù
# Disable All-Day Slots
#* Check case: there is no available in a specific day. Take action ‚ÄúDisable All-Day Slots‚Äù.
#* Check case:  Specific day has full slot. Take action ‚ÄúDisable All-Day Slots‚Äù .
#* Picking store disable itself time slot({color:#0747a6}PD-10 see detail). {color}
#* Picking store close linked store time slot.
# Adding a Delivery Time - Functionality ({color:#0747a6}PD-11){color}
#* Check on linked store: there is no button.
#* Check on picking/regular stores: this button is visible.
#* Click on ‚ÄúAdd Time Slot‚Äù incase of no setting from back office ( empty text fields)
#* Click on ‚ÄúAdd Time Slot‚Äù incase has setting.
#* Check ‚ÄúAdd Delivery Time‚Äù hover in the calendar ({color:#0747a6}PD-12{color})
# ‚ÄúDelivery Time‚Äù Pop-up Functionality
#* Check picking stores, ‚ÄúDelivery Time‚Äù Pop-up have editable fields ({color:#0747a6}PD-13{color})
#* Check incase of regular stores and linked stores.
#* Check Popup detail from ({color:#0747a6}PD 14- 23{color})
#** Check pop up tittle ({color:#0747a6}PD-14{color})
#** Fields: ‚ÄúDate‚Äù, ‚ÄúStart time‚Äù, ‚ÄúEnd times‚Äù ({color:#0747a6}PD-15{color}).

#* Incase ‚ÄúIs Active‚Äù = ON inside group management
#** check picking store:
#*** Check pop up message appear for the first time access "Delivery Times" page({color:#0747a6}*PD-1): Passed*{color}
#*** Check translation of this message
#*** Check press ‚ÄúConfirm‚Äù button , unified delivery slot settings appears: *Passed*
#*** Check case Do not press ‚Äúconfirm button‚Äù ‚Üí What happens?
#*** Check incase access "Delivery Times" page second time: no pop up message
#*** Check ‚Äúbutton:Apply Delivery Slots to Linked Stores ‚Äù is visible ({color:#0747a6}PD- 2.1{color}): *Passed*
#*** Press ‚ÄúApply Delivery slots to linked stores‚Äù button
#**** Confirm Action dialog appear ({color:#0747a6}PD- 2.2{color})
#**** Check language of confirm action dialog
#**** Check Calendar  appear: display today info by default, select some day
#**** Add Time Start;.. to:‚Ä¶.
#**** Press Cancel ‚Üí check nothing is applied
#**** Open the Confirm Action dialog again ‚Üí press Apply ({color:#0747a6}PD- 2.3{color})
#***** By clicking on the ‚ÄúApply,‚Äù the "Apply delivery slot settings to linked stores" button will be removed.
#***** Check the selected apply will be sync to linked store: check at back office of linked store and place order from linked store
#***** Check Linked stores will not be able to add/edit delivery slots, only watch their details on the calendar case: Linked store has the same retailer with picking store, Linked store is not the same retailer with picking store
#***** Check language translation of this screen.
#** Check linked store incase ‚ÄúIs Active‚Äù = ON
#*** Access "Delivery Times" page from linked store
#*** Check linked store do not have ‚ÄúApply Delivery Slots‚Äù
#** Check regular store: which do not have this setting too.
#* FLOW: Turn on ‚Üí turn off ‚Üí turn on again. Check behavior of system.
# New ‚ÄúDelivery Times‚Äù page Display
#* Indication ({color:#0747a6}PD- 3{color})
#** Linked store: there is ("Picking Store: [Store Name]") indication and delivery times display: *Passed* ( check at spqa)
#** Picking store: picking store indication and delivery times display: *Passed* ( check at Eily)
#** Regular store: no indication, check delivery times display: *Passed* (check storewise) 
#** FLOW: change store from regular ‚Üí linked store ‚Üí remove group ‚Üí become picking store ‚Üí become regular again.{color:#ff5630} {color}{color:#ff5630}*Not Yet*{color}
#* Day/Week/Today's Schedule ({color:#0747a6}PD- 4{color})
#** Check Day View :  {color:#ff991f}Failed{color} by ‚ÄúECOM-4464‚Äù
#** Select TODAY button -> change to DAY display view:  *Passed* on 3 types of stores
#** Check Week view: *Passed* 
#** Check .. dots: *Passed*
#* Check +‚ÄúDelivery Type‚Äù drop-down (+{color:#0747a6}+PD-5+{color}+)+
#** Switch forth and back delivery type.
#* Check +List of Delivery Area Checkboxes (filter)  (+{color:#4c9aff}+PD-6+{color}+)+
#** Check by default, all check boxes are checked
#** Select some check boxes, he corresponding delivery slots for that area will be hidden.
#** Change the colors black/pink
#* Go to delivery setting button: {color:#0747a6}PD-7{color}
#** Picking store: display this button.
#** Click on this button
#** Check linked Store/ Regular store: do not display this button.
#** Check lick on apply, it will re-direct to Configurations > Settings > ‚ÄúDelivery Settings‚Äù tab.
#* Statistics button: {color:#0747a6}PD-8{color}
#** Check info display on graph is correct.
#** Check that regular store will only have ‚ÄúAreas‚Äù statistics displayed.
#* Deliver slots window and hover should include:{color:#0747a6}PD-9{color}
#** Check hour range with format: AM: AM, AM: PM, PM: PM. Sensitive time duration such as: 0 AM: 12 PM, 0 AM: 23PM.
#** Check correct message for picking store:‚Äù+For a picking store:+ [Received orders from the Picking Store and linked stores] out of [total order capacity]. For example, 8/10.‚Äù incase:
#*** valid case: 0/max, 1/max-1.
#*** valid case: -1/max, --100/max+1
#** Check correct message for linked store:‚Äù+For a linked store:+ [Received orders from the linked store] out of [the picking store's allocation]‚Äù
# Disable All-Day Slots
#* Check case: there is no available in a specific day. Take action ‚ÄúDisable All-Day Slots‚Äù.
#* Check case:  Specific day has full slot. Take action ‚ÄúDisable All-Day Slots‚Äù .
#* Picking store disable itself time slot({color:#0747a6}PD-10 see detail). {color}
#* Picking store close linked store time slot.
# Adding a Delivery Time - Functionality ({color:#0747a6}PD-11){color}
#* Check on linked store: there is no button.
#* Check on picking/regular stores: this button is visible.
#* Click on ‚ÄúAdd Time Slot‚Äù incase of no setting from back office ( empty text fields)
#* Click on ‚ÄúAdd Time Slot‚Äù incase has setting.
#* Check ‚ÄúAdd Delivery Time‚Äù hover in the calendar ({color:#0747a6}PD-12{color})
# ‚ÄúDelivery Time‚Äù Pop-up Functionality
#* Check picking stores, ‚ÄúDelivery Time‚Äù Pop-up have editable fields ({color:#0747a6}PD-13{color})
#* Check incase of regular stores and linked stores.
#* Check Popup detail from ({color:#0747a6}PD 14- 23{color})
#** Check pop up tittle ({color:#0747a6}PD-14{color})
#** Fields: ‚ÄúDate‚Äù, ‚ÄúStart time‚Äù, ‚ÄúEnd times‚Äù ({color:#0747a6}PD-15{color}).

#***** By clicking on the ‚ÄúApply,‚Äù the "Apply delivery slot settings to linked stores" button will be removed.
#***** Check the selected apply will be sync to linked store: check at back office of linked store and place order from linked store
#***** Check Linked stores will not be able to add/edit delivery slots, only watch their details on the calendar case: Linked store has the same retailer with picking store, Linked store is not the same retailer with picking store
#***** Check language translation of this screen.

#*** Check linked store do not have ‚ÄúApply Delivery Slots‚Äù
#** Check regular store: which do not have this setting too.

# New ‚ÄúDelivery Times‚Äù page Display

#** Linked store: there is ("Picking Store: [Store Name]") indication and delivery times display: *Passed* ( check at spqa)
#** Picking store: picking store indication and delivery times display: *Passed* ( check at Eily)
#** Regular store: no indication, check delivery times display: *Passed* (check storewise)

#** Check Week view: *Passed* ( old version is not support hight light week) 
#** Check .. dots: *Passed*

#** Switch forth and back delivery type: *Passed*

#* Go to delivery setting button: {color:#0747a6}PD-7{color}

#** Select some check boxes, he corresponding delivery slots for that area will be hidden: *Passed*
#** Change the colors black/pink: *N/A*. Or confirm on ‚ÄúPD-244‚Äù
#** Add new area from picking store with new delivery type: {color:#ff991f}*Failed*{color} ECOM-4493
#** Deactive/ inactivate area from picking store with same existing delivery type: *Passed*
#** Add/remove areas from linked store: *Passed*
#* Go to delivery setting button: {color:#0747a6}PD-7{color}
#** Picking store: display this button: *Passed*
#** Check linked Store/ Regular store: do not display this button: *Passed*
#** Check lick on apply, it will re-direct to Configurations > Settings > ‚ÄúDelivery Settings‚Äù tab: *Passed*
#* {color:#6554c0}Deliver slots window and hover should include:PD-9{color}
#** {color:#6554c0}Check hour range with format: AM: AM, AM: PM, PM: PM. Sensitive time duration such as: 0 AM: 12 PM, 0 AM: 23PM.{color}

#** check picking store:

PD - 15.1: By clicking the "Add Delivery Time" button within the calendar, the selected time frame and corresponding date will be automatically populated into these fields : *Passed*
PD - 15.2: Clicking on the edit icon allows you to change the text fields as needed: 
PD - 15.3: If the ‚ÄúRegulation 55‚Äù feature is active, and the defined time is more than 2 hours, a red message will appear: ‚ÄúThe period is more than the two hours allowed by law‚Ä¶‚Äù (saving is disabled) - Same functionality, different design. 
PD - 15.3.1: In this case (‚ÄúDelivery Settings‚Äù tab > Regulation 55), there is an additional component at the bottom of the popup- ‚ÄúDelivery within 2 hours‚Äù (exists today - new design).
PD - 16: "Area" Dropdown:
The picking store will be required to select an area from the list of available areas within the picking store.
Mandatory field
Different design.
PD - 17: Reoccurring Weekly: 
Same functionality, different design
PD - 18: Order Count / Capacity in This Time Slot
Only for a picking store: [Received orders from the Picking Store and linked stores] out of [total order capacity]. For example, 8/10.
PD - 18.1: Relevant only for the pop-up editing: a collapse feature should appear, when you expand the collapsed view, you'll see how many deliveries each store got at this time, compared to what the picking store allocated to them. The "Inactive" label appears if a store disabled slots that day.
PD - 19: ‚ÄúDelivery Slot Type‚Äù and ‚ÄúDelivery Product Barcode‚Äù Dropdowns: 
Same functionality.
PD - 20: ‚ÄúQuota Settings‚Äù title and ‚ÄúDeliveries Quota‚Äù
Same functionality, different design - the ‚ÄúDeliveries Quota‚Äù was moved under the ‚ÄúOuota Settings‚Äù title.
PD - 21: ‚ÄúTagged user‚Äôs Reservation‚Äù settings 
Same functionality, different design - we have added a title.
The settings of PD- 21 and PD- 22 (‚ÄúTagged user‚Äôs reservation‚Äù and ‚ÄúLinked Stores Delivery Slot Reservation‚Äù) will only appear if a quantity for the delivery has been defined.

#** FLOW: change store from regular ‚Üí linked store ‚Üí remove group ‚Üí become picking store ‚Üí become regular again.{color:#ff5630} {color}{color:#ff5630}*Not Yet*{color}
#* Day/Week/Today's Schedule ({color:#0747a6}PD- 4{color})
#** Check Day View :  {color:#ff991f}*Failed*{color} by ‚ÄúECOM-4464‚Äù
#** Select TODAY button -> change to DAY display view:  *Passed* on 3 types of stores
#** Check Week view: *Passed* ( old version is not support hight light week) 
#** Check .. dots: *Passed*
#* Check +‚ÄúDelivery Type‚Äù drop-down (+{color:#0747a6}+PD-5+{color}+)+
#** Switch forth and back delivery type: *Passed*
#* Check +List of Delivery Area Checkboxes (filter)  (+{color:#4c9aff}+PD-6+{color}+)+
#** Check by default, all check boxes are checked : {color:#ff991f}*Failed*{color} ECOM-4467
#** Select some check boxes, he corresponding delivery slots for that area will be hidden: *Passed*
#** Change the colors black/pink: *N/A*. Or confirm on ‚ÄúPD-244‚Äù
#** Add new area from picking store with new delivery type: {color:#ff991f}*Failed*{color} ECOM-4493
#** Deactive/ inactivate area from picking store with same existing delivery type: *Passed*
#** Add/remove areas from linked store: *Passed*
#* Go to delivery setting button: {color:#0747a6}PD-7{color}
#** Picking store: display this button: *Passed*
#** Check linked Store/ Regular store: do not display this button: *Passed*
#** Check lick on apply, it will re-direct to Configurations > Settings > ‚ÄúDelivery Settings‚Äù tab: *Passed*
#* {color:#6554c0}Deliver slots window and hover should include:PD-9{color}
#** {color:#6554c0}Check hour range with format: AM: AM, AM: PM, PM: PM. Sensitive time duration such as: 0 AM: 12 PM, 0 AM: 23PM.{color}
#** {color:#6554c0}Check correct message for picking store:‚Äù{color}{color:#6554c0}+For a picking store:+ {color}{color:#6554c0}[Received orders from the Picking Store and linked stores] out of [total order capacity]. For example, 8/10.‚Äù incase:{color}
#*** {color:#6554c0}valid case: 0/max, 1/max-1.{color}
#*** {color:#6554c0}valid case: -1/max, --100/max+1{color}
#** {color:#6554c0}Check correct message for linked store:‚Äù{color}{color:#6554c0}+For a linked store:+{color}{color:#6554c0} [Received orders from the linked store] out of [the picking store's allocation]‚Äù{color}
#* {color:#6554c0}Disable All-Day Slots{color}
#** {color:#6554c0}Check case: there is no available in a specific day. Take action ‚ÄúDisable All-Day Slots‚Äù.{color}
#** {color:#6554c0}Check case:  Specific day has full slot. Take action ‚ÄúDisable All-Day Slots‚Äù .{color}
#** {color:#6554c0}Picking store disable itself time slot(PD-10 see detail). {color}
#** {color:#6554c0}Picking store close linked store time slot.{color}
# Adding a Delivery Time - Functionality ({color:#0747a6}PD-11){color}
#* Check on linked store: there is no button: *Passed*
#* Check on picking/regular stores: this button is visible: *Passed*
#* Check ‚ÄúAdd Delivery Time‚Äù hover in the calendar ({color:#0747a6}PD-12{color}) : {color:#bf2600}*Failed* {color}by ‚ÄúECOM-4498‚Äù
# ‚ÄúDelivery Time‚Äù Pop-up Functionality
#* Check picking stores, ‚ÄúDelivery Time‚Äù Pop-up have editable fields ({color:#0747a6}PD-13{color}): *Passed*
#* Check incase of regular stores and linked stores.
#* Check Popup detail from ({color:#0747a6}PD 14- 23{color}) {color:#bf2600}*Failed*{color} by ‚ÄúECOM-4455‚Äù
#** Check pop up tittle ({color:#0747a6}PD-14{color}) : *Passed*
PD - 15.1: By clicking the "Add Delivery Time" button within the calendar, the selected time frame and corresponding date will be automatically populated into these fields : *Passed*
PD - 15.2: Clicking on the edit icon allows you to change the text fields as needed: 
PD - 15.3: If the ‚ÄúRegulation 55‚Äù feature is active, and the defined time is more than 2 hours, a red message will appear: ‚ÄúThe period is more than the two hours allowed by law‚Ä¶‚Äù (saving is disabled) - Same functionality, different design. 
PD - 15.3.1: In this case (‚ÄúDelivery Settings‚Äù tab > Regulation 55), there is an additional component at the bottom of the popup- ‚ÄúDelivery within 2 hours‚Äù (exists today - new design).
PD - 16: "Area" Dropdown:
The picking store will be required to select an area from the list of available areas within the picking store.
Mandatory field
Different design.
PD - 17: Reoccurring Weekly: 
Same functionality, different design
PD - 18: Order Count / Capacity in This Time Slot
Only for a picking store: [Received orders from the Picking Store and linked stores] out of [total order capacity]. For example, 8/10.
PD - 18.1: Relevant only for the pop-up editing: a collapse feature should appear, when you expand the collapsed view, you'll see how many deliveries each store got at this time, compared to what the picking store allocated to them. The "Inactive" label appears if a store disabled slots that day.
PD - 19: ‚ÄúDelivery Slot Type‚Äù and ‚ÄúDelivery Product Barcode‚Äù Dropdowns: 
Same functionality.
PD - 20: ‚ÄúQuota Settings‚Äù title and ‚ÄúDeliveries Quota‚Äù
Same functionality, different design - the ‚ÄúDeliveries Quota‚Äù was moved under the ‚ÄúOuota Settings‚Äù title.
PD - 21: ‚ÄúTagged user‚Äôs Reservation‚Äù settings 
Same functionality, different design - we have added a title.
The settings of PD- 21 and PD- 22 (‚ÄúTagged user‚Äôs reservation‚Äù and ‚ÄúLinked Stores Delivery Slot Reservation‚Äù) will only appear if a quantity for the delivery has been defined.

#** Check lick on apply, it will re-direct to Configurations > Settings > ‚ÄúDelivery Settings‚Äù tab: *Passed*
#* {color:#6554c0}Deliver slots window and hover should include:PD-9{color}
#** {color:#6554c0}Check hour range with format: AM: AM, AM: PM, PM: PM. Sensitive time duration such as: 0 AM: 12 PM, 0 AM: 23PM.{color}
#** {color:#6554c0}Check correct message for picking store:‚Äù{color}{color:#6554c0}+For a picking store:+ {color}{color:#6554c0}[Received orders from the Picking Store and linked stores] out of [total order capacity]. For example, 8/10.‚Äù incase:{color}
#*** {color:#6554c0}valid case: 0/max, 1/max-1.{color}
#*** {color:#6554c0}valid case: -1/max, --100/max+1{color}
#** {color:#6554c0}Check correct message for linked store:‚Äù{color}{color:#6554c0}+For a linked store:+{color}{color:#6554c0} [Received orders from the linked store] out of [the picking store's allocation]‚Äù{color}
#* {color:#6554c0}Disable All-Day Slots{color}
#** {color:#6554c0}Check case: there is no available in a specific day. Take action ‚ÄúDisable All-Day Slots‚Äù.{color}
#** {color:#6554c0}Check case:  Specific day has full slot. Take action ‚ÄúDisable All-Day Slots‚Äù .{color}
#** {color:#6554c0}Picking store disable itself time slot(PD-10 see detail). {color}
#** {color:#6554c0}Picking store close linked store time slot.{color}
# Adding a Delivery Time - Functionality ({color:#0747a6}PD-11){color}
#* Check on linked store: there is no button: *Passed*
#* Check on picking/regular stores: this button is visible: *Passed*
#* Check ‚ÄúAdd Delivery Time‚Äù hover in the calendar ({color:#0747a6}PD-12{color}) : {color:#bf2600}*Failed* {color}by ‚ÄúECOM-4498‚Äù
# ‚ÄúDelivery Time‚Äù Pop-up Functionality
#* Check picking stores, ‚ÄúDelivery Time‚Äù Pop-up have editable fields ({color:#0747a6}PD-13{color}): *Passed*
#* Check incase of regular stores and linked stores.
#* Check Popup detail from ({color:#0747a6}PD 14- 23{color}) {color:#bf2600}*Failed*{color} by ‚ÄúECOM-4455‚Äù
#** Check pop up tittle ({color:#0747a6}PD-14{color}) : *Passed*
PD - 15.1: By clicking the "Add Delivery Time" button within the calendar, the selected time frame and corresponding date will be automatically populated into these fields : *Passed*
PD - 15.2: Clicking on the edit icon allows you to change the text fields as needed: *Passed*
PD - 15.3: If the ‚ÄúRegulation 55‚Äù feature is active, and the defined time is more than 2 hours, a red message will appear: ‚ÄúThe period is more than the two hours allowed by law‚Ä¶‚Äù (saving is disabled) - Same functionality, different design. 
PD - 15.3.1: In this case (‚ÄúDelivery Settings‚Äù tab > Regulation 55), there is an additional component at the bottom of the popup- ‚ÄúDelivery within 2 hours‚Äù (exists today - new design).
PD - 16: "Area" Dropdown: *Passed*
PD - 17: Reoccurring Weekly: *Passed*
PD - 18: Order Count / Capacity in This Time Slot:{color:#403294} {color}{color:#403294}*Passed*{color}{color:#403294} {color}{color:#403294}*on UI. Need check function*{color}
Only for a picking store: [Received orders from the Picking Store and linked stores] out of [total order capacity]. For example, 8/10.
PD - 18.1: Relevant only for the pop-up editing: a collapse feature should appear, when you expand the collapsed view, you'll see how many deliveries each store got at this time, compared to what the picking store allocated to them. The "Inactive" label appears if a store disabled slots that day.
PD - 19: ‚ÄúDelivery Slot Type‚Äù and ‚ÄúDelivery Product Barcode‚Äù Dropdowns: 
Same functionality.
PD - 20: ‚ÄúQuota Settings‚Äù title and ‚ÄúDeliveries Quota‚Äù
Same functionality, different design - the ‚ÄúDeliveries Quota‚Äù was moved under the ‚ÄúOuota Settings‚Äù title.
PD - 21: ‚ÄúTagged user‚Äôs Reservation‚Äù settings 
Same functionality, different design - we have added a title.
The settings of PD- 21 and PD- 22 (‚ÄúTagged user‚Äôs reservation‚Äù and ‚ÄúLinked Stores Delivery Slot Reservation‚Äù) will only appear if a quantity for the delivery has been defined.
